medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant pain associated with gallstones.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has been experiencing right upper quadrant pain for multiple months, which is sharp and radiates to the back. The pain has been increasing in frequency and duration and is often accompanied by nausea after meals. ED visit confirmed gallstones, and pain has been worsening throughout the day and disrupts sleep at night. Symptoms are not relieved with Percocet.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Iron deficiency anemia, gastritis, subclinical hypothyroidism, history of molar pregnancy complicated by miscarriage (status post D&C for incomplete abortion), adjustment disorder following miscarriage, scoliosis.
